features: New Tritan feeding system with detachable handles that grows with your baby- from birth to toddler. Made with ultra durable and crystal clear Tritan from Eastman.
Non-drip nipple features teething nubs that massage and stimulate baby's gums, plus No-Spill spout easily replaces nipple when your child is ready for the transition to cup drinking.

Vari-flo valve allows baby to control liquid's flow rate with nipple and spout. Liquid measurement markings -oz and ml- are on the base of the cup allow you to know how much liquid your baby has consumed.
Easy Grip removable handles can be used when baby is ready for self-feeding, the handles are textured to allow for an easy and firm grip.
body.description: The 3 stages include a non-drip nipple, No-Spill spout, and easy grip handles. This bottle helps baby transition from bottle to cup. Also the handles are designed for baby's little hands to hold when baby starts self-feeding!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Non Drop Nipple The Non-Drip Nipple Is Uniquely Designed Prevent Drips And Spills. With Your Baby's Comfort In Mind An Anti-Colic Feature Was Designed In The Nipple, Helping To Prevent Ingestion Of Air By Baby, Which May Cause Colic. The New Nipple Features Raised Offset Surfaces That Assist In The Eruption Of New Teeth Vari-Flo The Vari-Flo valve allows your child to control the liquid flow rate. The pressure sensitive valve feature safely built right into the nipple, fluid only flows out of the nipple with the sucking actions of baby. This special valve closes when the sucking action ceases Transition from Bottle to Cup with Ease Your little one will find the transition from bottle to cup an easy one with the No-Spill SoftFlex silicone spout. The No Spill soft silicone spout is ideal for 1st sips.

Detachable Easy Grip Handles When baby is ready to hold the bottle on their own, add the Easy Grip handles. The textured handles allow baby to get a firm grip while drinking. The twin handles, help babies guide the cup to their mouth and drink by themselves Liquid Measurement Markings- oz & ml Liquid measurement markings on the base of the cup allow you to know how much liquid your baby has consumed. The 3-Stage Non-Drip Bottle to Cup holds 8 oz / 240 ml. 3 months + The Nuby Tritan Bottle to Cup is recommended for babies 3 months and older.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to transition
reviews.reviewText: My toddler is super picky about sippy cups and he actually uses these! We've tried just about every brand and style, and he hated them all except this one! We had to buy more! Very durable as well and don't leak which is a plus.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best teta, cup, bottle what ever you call it
reviews.reviewText: I started using this bottle as soon as I found it around 6months for my son. Started using the bottle portion and once he turned about 10 months started transitioning to the sippy cup top. This is hands down the best cup. My son is very picky. These bottle don't leaks like the ones he preffered Dr browns . If you do shake them or they fall they might spill a little but it's nothing compared to other bottles. I been buying theses non stop and the transition was so easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The ONLY actual spill proof toddler cup!!
reviews.reviewText: I have looked far and wide for an ACTUAL spill proof bottle/sippy. THIS IS IT! Others still leak a little when you shake them. This one does not. I put it thru all the tests because my 2 yr old is in a savage sabotage phase and deliberately tries to spill her milk. Needless to say I was sick of smelling spilled milk and having to hunt down the source like a hound dog, so I started looking for a cup/bottle that wouldn’t spill. I mean it when I say this WILL NOT spill. Just don’t stick a nipple brush thru the nipple hole. If you do, it will eventually start leaking a TINY bit. I mean I have to really shake the one that I did this on to get it to leak. This is the only kind I’m buying from now on. I currently have 6!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this cup for my daughter when she turned one to try and get her off her bottle. It’s a great transition cup. It comes with two nipples which is great too

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great First Start Sippy Cup!
reviews.reviewText: The ONLY sippy cup that has worked for my daughter, she used Phillips Avent bottles and no other sippy would work for her. She refused then I got this one as a gift and ever since then she’s been using them, purchased 4 more. Will be purchasing another 2-4 to complete what I need. But SO HAPPY WITH MY Purchase, leak proof spill proof for sure, her baby bottle would leak SO MUCH, other sippy, terrible, this one . No issues!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this bottle!
reviews.reviewText: My son loves this bottle so much. He’s 8months old and transitioning to sippy cups, handle is perfect and nipples easily adaptable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My son really likes this cup and I think it’s good for his transitioning into a sippy cup

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent transitioning bottle for a 2yr old who refuses to let the "bottle" go
reviews.reviewText: My 2 yr old refuses to let the "bottle" go. It's his pacifier, his security blanket. He rejects the sippy cup so this was a great alternative to be able to toss out the baby bottles. The handles are removable and the nipple is less like a baby bottle nipple. Unfortunately the seal can some times not align properly and you have to put a little more effort to align than you would a traditional bottle (it has less rotation & space between the handles) but otherwise it works great. I also don't know how my baby managed to get a hole/crack I'm the recessed center of the nipple but it's there and now fluid leaks out a little more. Mixing a little chocolate in with the milk can get a bit messy shaking it up. Can leak from the nipple and ring. The bottle shape is nice but he makes use of the handles which is great and on target for development.
